text: Pours hazy yellow with white head. Aroma is nicely spicy with good amount of banana, but not overpowering like you get with some American wheats. Bananas and fruits continue in the mouth, backed with a slight sourness that is pleasant, and a light wheat sweetness the lasts through the finish. Really well balanced, easy to drink

I figured a beer like this, which has a description hinting at fruit flavors, would be sweet. Its...not. Its quite bland overall and doesnt offer much to remember. A fine beer to drink, but really lacks character everywhere youd look for it.

I prefer hefes vs IPAs. To me, this is the best tasting hefe Ive had. I cant always find it, and when I can, its affordable. I cant stand the taste of hops in my beer but with this one, it adds to the finish. Its so slight, you can barely notice it. This is in my top 5 favorite beers! Kudos, Victory.

Brown bottle, 1 pint 6 ounces, best before April 26 2016, savoured on October 14 2015; eye: golden, clear, no effervescence, tiny ring of greyish head, light lacing; nose: bread, wheat, acidity, light residual sugar, slight malt; mouth: bread, wheat, acidity, light residual sugar, slight malt, finale in wheat with light presence of sulfur, light body, good carbonation, slightly sweet, lightly grainy texture; overall: fine

FRANÇAIS

Bouteille brune, 1 pinte 6 onces, meilleure avant le 26 avril 2016, savourée le 14 octobre 2015; il : dorée, limpide, pas deffervescence, petit anneau de mousse grisâtre, légère dentelle; nez : pain, blé, acidité, léger sucre résiduel, très léger malt; bouche : pain, blé, acidité, léger sucre résiduel, très léger malt, finale en blé avec légère présence de soufre, corps léger, bonne carbonatation, très légèrement sucrée, texture légèrement granuleuse; en résumé : bien

bottle. Golden with one finger head. Im not sure why this hasnt caught on more, but this is a pretty solid hefe that has been hopped up a bit. Underlying hefe is aboverage with some sweet wheat and light banana. Hops arent overdone, but add a nice kick to the finish. Recommended.

UPDATED: JAN 4, 2016 Not a good weizen. Color is too light and the foam too thin. Also too thin, the palate. Flavor is light, some wheat sweetness, no banana, clove. Some haze but lacks the opaque appearance of better German examples. It is not a cheap beer in a 22 oz bottle which makes all of these problems worse.

Bottle: Poured a lightly hazy blonde color ale with a nice pure white foamy head. Aroma of light wheat malt with dry hoppy finish. Taste is a mix of wheat malt notes with light sweet notes offset by some dry non-deScript hops notes. Body is about average with good carbonation. Not bad but seems like this one is stuck between the classic weizen and the hoppyweizen and is not sure where to go at.

Cloudy straw yellow with a lumpy white head that fades slowly to a coating and laces. Aroma is bready malts and yeast. Taste is the same but with hints of lemon and bubblegum and a light noble hop bitterness out back. Very drinkable. Mild flavors and probably a good choice for a non Weiss lover.
Pours clear straw with some foamy head and lots of lacing. Nose/Flavours floral, banana, yeast and cereal. Taste light bitter, light sweet. Light body with light carbonation.

A hazed golden Weisse with a thin white head. In aroma, sweet creamy fruity malt with light chalky character, light banana esters and phenolics, nice. In mouth, a nice sweet fruity malt with light grassy banana esters, cloves, light oxidation, chalky character, OK. Bottle via Spinrsx.

Tap. Pours hazy pale Amber, small off white head, solid lacing. Aroma is banana, clove, wheat. Flavor follows, light sweet, minimal bitterness, lots of clove, bit of bubblegum, touch of lemon. Light plus body.

Sample from the brewery. Pours a clear pale yellow with a white head. Aromas of bread and a fruity grapey yeast aroma. Very faint banana. More pils like. Taste is lightly sweet but mostly crisp. Very traditional.

Bomber from Andersons in Dublin (I think): gold pour with big fluffy white head and visible carbonation. aroma of spices - clove, bread, background banana. tastes are wheat, clove, honey, apple. palate is lively medium. finishes dry and lightly bitter. clean and good balance. dont drink the style much anymore, so its tough to place. solid generally.
Pours a golden color with a medium sized foamy white head. Notes of honey banana and clover cereal. Missing that rubber and heavy bubblegum of most hefes.

Pours hazy yellow with white head. Aroma is nicely spicy with good amount of banana, but not overpowering like you get with some American wheats. Bananas and fruits continue in the mouth, backed with a slight sourness that is pleasant, and a light wheat sweetness the lasts through the finish. Really well balanced, easy to drink, and one of my favorite wheats.

bottle, popped near the end of the orgy .. . pours a cloudy yellow amber .. mild foam .. yeast, cereal, and light banana .. mouth is light and dissipating .. quick finish, a bit empty .. . . Fuck em. If youre kryptonite is peanuts, maybe youre just not meant for this world.
Cloudy gold, not much head. Smells like banana, clove, some crackery malts. Very soft palate. Taste is water cracker, some fruity notes, some black peppery. Finishes sweet. I liked it.

Aromas of wheat, a touch of clove, and bubblegum. The body is a hazy mid yellow with a thin cap that disappeared quickly.Flavor of malted wheat, grass with a touch of alcohol on the back end. Overall it was ok, being from Victory i was hoping for a bit more.

(bomber) Had this on tap awhile back and was quite impressed, and seeing this now available in MN, I was tempted to pick it up. I regret this decision. Pours a hazy golden color with a quickly dissipating white head. Aside from the quickly dissipating white head, this certainly looks the part. The aroma is where all things go south quickly, with competing scents of bubble gum, lemon peel, pine, caramel corn, and lemon pledge (the peel turns more artificial with warming). It smells like a cross between a bad belgian blonde ale and a middling IPA. Flavor holds little kicks of bubblegum, banana, tart wheat towards the finish,a mineral component, with little stinging stabs of hops closer towards the end of the finish. Theres a bit of cereal in here too, but I cant tell whether its more like Kix or more like Capt Crunch. Mouthfeel is nice. Im not sure if they changed their recipe since I had this awhile back, but this is nothing like the beer I had on tap a few years ago. I shouldve read the description before buying as it states that this is a departure from the traditional hefeweizen, and having read that I wouldve likely put it back on the shelf.
Light gold pour, white head. Nose is yeast & wheat malt. More sweet than dry. Middle is faint banana, faint bubblegum, and medium wheat. Finish is light and sweet.
Draft. Clear gold beer with a tall white foamy head. Sweet aroma, some banana, medium carbonation. Solid hefe
Bottle. Aroma is big banana, clove, and wheat. Tastes like strong wheat, pretty dry. Light banana nut bread and clove. High carbonation. Slightly creamy in the mouthfeel. Solid hefe.

650 ml. Slightly hazy golden body with a thin disc of creamy foam. Aroma of clove-spiced honey, wheat and a touch of banana nut bread. Flavors are the same but with more crispness than revealed in the nose. Light-medium body has a nice balance with a long, spicy-dry finish to answer the sweet malt. Pleasantly surprised by the low-medium carbonation level.
Solid version of a hefe for sure. Banana and clove are there but light, as is the bubble gum yeast. Fruity and refreshing.
Bottle, orange color with white foam, nice aroma of bananas and wheat, flavor is balanced banana, cream of wheat, baked bread, good not too sweet finish

Cloudy straw, white head, creamy lacing, and decent head retention. Wheat, mild lemon, banana, and mild spice. Medium bodied, mild spice, wheat, biscuit, and mild lemon. Nice balance, dry notes, medium bitterness, and mild tart notes. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
One of my favorite Victory beers. Complex spicy, wheat taste that goes down smooth. A must try if like this style.

Bomber into pint glass, cloudy golden color with cream-colored head. Aroma notes of wheat malt, banana, clove, light pepper and some citrus. Taste adds some grain, bready malt sweetness and light fruitiness. Light-medium body, moderate-low carbonation, creamy with yeasty malt finish. Pretty solid hefe.

shared bomber bottle.
This is a fine version of the style that could easily pass for a very good Bavarian hefe. Banana and clove, as expected, but neither is overly prominent.
Very nice. Pure clear yellow pour with white head. Aroma is wheat and clean. Taste is undercooked biscuit. I like.

Sparkling clean bright yellow pour,with a nice white head that was lasting. Aroma is banana fruit, light bread with a bubble gum, and clove sweetness. The flavor is some lemon citrus, light banana bread with a little sweetness. It had a little hop taste in the finish, light citrus acid and banana and pear like. Very nice carbonation, and a very pretty beer. A stronger hefeweizen at 6.2% abv, but a nice balanced beer that was refreshing and enjoyable.

Had on tap at a VORLAUF meeting at Bleu Cafe, summer 2014. Nice orange pour with a good khaki head, nice lacing. Good aroma, a balance of banana and mild spice, a nice cream aspect, bready. Good flavor, not as good as the aroma led on - more spice/clove pop, not as much balance, but still good. Tasty!

Hazy straw pour with a smallish white head. Aroma is yeasty, with some banana and black pepper. Nice creamy body, spicy up front leading to some banana and clove flavors. Straw and yeasty finish, even a bit of sweetness. Pretty flavorful and complex for the style, excellent brew.

This one poured a semi hazy yellow with a white head, Aroma was of bubble gum wheaty yeast and thats about it. Flavor was similar, a very good classic hefe from description, but im not a big fan of bubblegum unfortunately

Rated on 02-28-2013 at Victory B.C. This draft beer has a small white head that mostly diminished, slightly hazy pale yellow/golden body, fast rising carbonation, and spotty amounts of lacing. The aroma is banana, spice, clove, sweet, and malt. The flavor is banana, light clove, sweet, and malt. The mouthfeel is creamy and smooth. This beer is medium bodied. This is a very quaffable that I would drink again and worth trying.
Decent hefe. Flavors and aromas of wheat, yeast, lemon, and spice. Bright yellow with fizzy head. Paired nicely with a paprika bbq sauce.
Great tasting German hefe. Great aroma an good balance of the flavor. Spicy.

Pours a half finger of head on a hazy light straw body.
The aroma is dry grains and a little lemon. Nice.
The taste is "wheat", lemon and a little spicy at the end. Good profile.
The texture is crisp.
Quite enjoyable.
Bottle. Pours orange gold white head. Nose/taste of wheat, banana, clove, coriander and light lemon peel. Lighter medium body.

One of the best bottled hefes Ive ever had. not much in the way of aroma. pours slightly lighter straw color, see thru, dense white head. Flavor is biscuity, doughy, but the yeast character is what sets it apart, clean, balanced alcohol and slight clove finish. Great sparkling carbonation, not sticky, well attenuated. Please make a crystalweiss version =p

Bottle MOderate grain and hay for the malt, light to moderate herbs for the hops, dough, cobwebs and musty for the yeast, with clove, pepper and cardboard. Head is huge, frothy turning rocky, white with fair lacing and is mostly lasting. Color is slightly hazy light amber. Flavor starts lightly sweet and finishes lightly sweet and acidic. Palate is medium, watery with a lively carbonation. Nice German Hefeweizen. After a tour of Bavaria I can say this one is near authentic tasting.

Bomber bottle. Pours golden with quickly disappearing head. Faint malt nose, minimal clove/banana here. Hop bitterness, malty. Nice but I wouldnt put in hefe category. A bit of a miss from a strong brewery.

Victory Mad Kings Weiss hangs right up there with its German competitors. Pour is clearer than expected from a Hefeweizen but with the same fluffy head. Has the aroma of sweet wheat and maybe a little banana notes. Taste is banana and bubblegum with a clean finish. Mad Kings would make King Ludwig proud!

Bottle:
Clear gold with a tall, frothy, white head.
Strong yeast and clove aroma..banana.
Taste is sweet, yeasty wheat malt, banana-cream.
Rich and dessert-sweet.

bottle @ Vino Bellissimo / Lima OH --- Hazy light amber with a good 1" frothy white head, bands of lace. Taste is wheat and malt that moves with ease through the palate, adding spice, particularly coriander. The finish has balance, but I cant say for sure that there are particular hops. Overall, refreshing and clean - a very good Hefe.

Savannah, Ga. - Habersham Beverage Warehouse - Abercorn - 22 oz bomber. Hazy, dark golden pour, initial white bubbly head that dissipates after a while. Nice hefe aroma with with some bubble gum and cloves. Solid flavor with some banana notes, a touch of cloves and some trailing bubble gum. Overall yeastiness pervades throughout the back end, Nice thick mouthfeel. Solid entrant, as expected from Victory.

Very light body despite being high in abv and having a great flavor for the style. Light citrus and wheat flavors. Also a bit of saison-like spice & yeast. Im pretty sure saison yeast is their secret ingredient, and it fits the beer perfectly.

On tap @ SL Liquors. Poured a bright slightly hazy golden color with a half inch white foamy head that retains well. Subtle aroma of wheat, light grain, and yeast, along with light clove, lemon peel, and banana. Taste starts with light spicy and peppery hop flavors with a tangy, crisp bite in the middle and slowly fade in the end. Sweet banana flavors follow the crisp bite in the middle along with a mild lemon zest in the finish. Sturdy, grainy, wheat malt backbone throughout. Medium bodied with assertive, tangy carbonation.

Poured from a bomber bottle: Cloudy and orange yellow, with some durable foam. Aroma was of Belgian yeast...a little funky and a little spicy. Flavor was co-dominated by spicy yeast and spicy hops.. A nice wheat maltiness and light fruit tied it all together. A little warming from more alcohol than I expected. Well made and enjoyable.
A bit watery...saison-y type beer light and slightly fruity...decent but nothing special

4oz pour at Churchkey DC pours a clear gold with a ring of white head. Nose has lots of yeasty esters, a bit of booze, banana, clove, malt. Flavor is slick, grassy, mildly buttery. Finishes kind of slick.

Wheaty aroma has a firm yeasty note and a not-so-subtle floral note. It pours a somewhat hazy golden yellow with a thick but effervescent eggshell head that leaves some good lacing. Crisp, refreshing flavor is wheaty and malty with a nice fruity underpinning that can be apple in one sip, lemon in the next, banana in the next. Mouthfeel is firm and smooth, if not overly fizzy. Perfect for a hot summer day thats driving you mad!

Hazy golden coloured body with a rich, three centimetre tall pure white head. Aroma of bananas, cloves, yeast, wheat and bunches of coriander seed - very fresh smelling. Medium-bodied; Assertive wheat and yeast flavours with a pungent banana kick, some light sweetness from honey and a very floral and spicey kick at the end. Aftertaste shows a very pungent kick with some sour lemons, a bit of yeast, dry wheat and a rich sweetness from honey. Overall, a nice german hef that rivals some of the best ones from the country, but made here in the good ole US of A. Definitely worth trying if you like the style and/or if you want a refreshing summer beer. I sampled this 65 cL bottle purchased from Whole Foods in Falls Church (Tysons Corner), Virginia on 10-July-2014 for US$5,49 sampled at home in Washington on 12-August-2014.
22 oz bomber pours hazy golden with a white head, aroma of malts, grass, yeast and fruit. Taste of malts, bananas, yeast and spice.

Clear straw pour with ring of white head. Nose and flavor is distinctly wheaty. But also with spicy notes of clove and bubblegum. Good citrus tange. Slightly yeasty and bitter on the finish. Pretty standard hefe, but doesnt go above that. Nothing amazing.

Bomber: Aroma is orange and coriander with some yeast. Appearance is a clear golden with a orange tinge and a medium to low head that does not linger at all. Taste is banana, coriander, yeast and some other fruit notes intermingled. Palate is medium carbonation with an aftertaste of fruit and yeast notes. Overall, a rather enjoyable beer. Cheers!

22 ounce bottle - $4.99 at Total Wine & More in Kennesaw, Georgia.

Appearance: Lightly clouded with a light hue of burnished gold. Smallish, white a head, a little fizzy. A few streams of active carbonation.

Smell: Subtly wheaty aroma, some grain, yeasty dough. Light clove bud, lemon peel, banana.

Taste: A taste of wheat with a doughy backdrop to it and a small, soft sugary element. The juice of one lemon with a little snap of acidity. Transient hints of clove, nana, and plain gum. Modestly hopped, a little herb and a low bitterness. Minor alcohol component. Wheaty and a bit spicy on the nicely drying, fairly effervescent finish.

Mouthfeel: Medium-light body. Medium-plus carbonation. A small appreciable amount of heft from the malts, but doesnt approach the creamiest of the style.

Overall: A little less than traditional with the use of Belgian yeast, though, the beer really doesnt stray far at all and is enjoyable none-the-less.

Transfer from BA review on 9-22-12-
 Served on tap in a pint glass

 Appearance Served a hazy golden yellow colored brew with a one finger white head. The head had a pretty good retention and eventually faded to leave some nice lacing on the sides of the glass.

 Smell - The aroma was biggest of a biscuit and yeasty smell. Mixed with these aromas were some lighter notes of pepper, citrus, and some herbal hops. Rather standard in many respects for a weiss.

 Taste  The taste begins with a biscuit and sweeter citrus fruit flavor. A yeast cake flavor 
quickly comes to the tongue. Soon after a banana and pepper flavor follow the yeast, bringing a more classic Weiss flavor to the brew. More toward the end of the taste a lemon citrus surges a bit and when combined with some flavors of a light grapefruit hop bring a yeasty, biscuity citrus flavor to the tongue.

 Mouthfeel The body of the beer was on the slightly thicker side for a weiss with a carbonation level that was very average. 

 Overall  Not bad. A pretty nice weiss with a bit more flavor and a better feel then most.

Bottle from Champanes, 
this beer had a hazy bright yellow pour with a hint of pale orange, and presented a creamy, white cover that lowered but was lasting, it left nice spots and fingers of lacing that slowly rolled off, 

the nose had nice banana fruit, light bread with bazooka bubble gum wrapper, faint clove and fruit sweetness with some lemon citrus, 

it had flavors of light banana, some lemon citrus, and bread with a little bread sweetness, the finish had little hops, light citrus and banana and pear like fruit, 

the mouth feel was light with generous carbonation on the palate, and it was creamy on the lips, 
this hefeweizen was heavier than your typical hefe at 6.2% alc. but it still felt light on the mouth, 

the nose had good banana and clove notes, the flavor was good to, this was a nice hefeweizen drink.

Nice, large bright white head of medium sized bubbles that reduces rather quickly. Light carbonation. Aroma of lemons, cereal grains, straw and some paper. Color is a medium gold with decent clarity for a wheat beer. Light and crisp flavor that is very easy drinking. Some pasta, lemongrass and wheat in the flavor. Rather dry with a lingering late bitterness. This is actually a pretty good and easy drinking brew.

Notes from Family Hefe Tasting. Looks like Miller High Life in the pour, with a spongey head. Aroma was grapey with a bit of plastic. Taste followed with a touch of spices. 10.8. This one finished next-to-last in the tasting, only beating Two Brothers Ebelweiss.

DATE REVIEWED: July 27, 2014... GLASSWARE: Weihenstephan weizen ... OCCASION: another chain saw and tractor day in the yard--but a sweet reward...APPEARANCE: handsome three-finger snow-white head that stays thick and creamy for a duration; appropriate, unfiltered hazy golden yellow body with steady effervescence; lacing is inconsistent but observable ... AROMA: alluring yeast of banana and fragrant candy; malts are understated but provide a doughy hint with some licorice to boot--a bit more complex than the ordinary hefe... PALATE: active, impactful and reasonably bodied--more weight than a weizen--with a heavier aftertaste as well; an astringent, creamy combination that makes this thirst-quenching but substantial... TASTE: banana and pepper, with some sweet malts mixed in; some warmth too... OVERALL: worth a bombers price, this beer is a bigger, somewhat bolder take on a refreshing style--like the Whirlwind with a little V Lager mixed with some nondescript spices that engages with strength...
Bomber thanks to tepp. Light with a white head. Not as sour or funky as I expected. Nice and light.

Tap at lazy dog. Pours clear gold with creamy white head. Aroma is banana, cloves, bready malts, wheat, and faint fruity pebbles. Flavor is malty with wheat, toast, spicy hops, banana, and light cream; dry finish. Light/medium body and medium carbonation.

Draft at Lazy Dog. Pours clear light gold with a fizzy white head. Tastes like sweet wheat, light banana, nice and smooth. Light body and low carbonation. Smells like what, toasted almond, light banana
It pours light golden color with a pillow white head. There is a heavy aroma of yeast, hay, and spices. It has an excellent compliment of spices combined with the yeast and other malt flavors.

Bottle from Capitol Beer & Tap Room. Pours golden with a huge fluffy white head and a spicy aroma. There is a sweet wheat flavor with some banana ester and a dry slightly bitter finish. A typical hefe.

From a large bottle poured in a glass. Looks like a typical hefeweizen. Flavor is fruitier than normal but not bitter. Good richness of flavor but still fairly light in body. Outstanding for an American beer of this style.

22 ounce bottle into weizen glass, best before 10/2/2014. Pours moderately hazy/cloudy bright gold color with a 2 finger dense and rocky white head with fantastic retention, that reduces to a nice cap that lasts. Nice spotty soapy lacing clings down the glass, with a moderate amount of streaming carbonation. Aromas of big lemon zest, banana, orange peel, pear, apple, pepper, clove, wheat, bread, light honey, light bubblegum, straw, grass, and yeast earthiness. Damn nice aromas with good balance and complexity of fruity/spicy yeast, pale malt, and hop notes; with good strength. Taste of lemon zest, banana, orange peel, pear, apple, pepper, clove, wheat, bread, light honey, light bubblegum, straw, grass, and yeast earthiness. Light earthy yeast spice on the finish; with lingering notes of lemon zest, banana, orange peel, pear, apple, clove, light pepper, wheat, bread, light honey, light bubblegum, straw, grass, and yeast earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Damn nice complexity, balance, and robustness of fruity/spicy yeast, pale malt, and hops flavors; with a great malt/yeast balance and zero cloying flavors after the finish. Medium-high carbonation and medium bodied; with a very smooth, crisp and fairly creamy/bready mouthfeel that is great. Alcohol is well hidden with minimal warming present after the finish. Overall this is an excellent hefeweizen! All around great complexity, balance, and robustness of fruity/spicy yeast, pale, malt, and hop flavors; and very smooth and crisp to drink. A very enjoyable offering.

Bottle. Poured clear and sparkling yellow with a big, nice white head. Aroma: bananas, clove, yeast and some citrus fruit notes. Taste of spice, wheat, bananas and a hint of hops. Refreshing and enjoyable.
Aroma is yeast, spices and medium strong wheat/grains. The flavor is fruit/berries, mild sweetness, spices,

22 ounce bottle. Served in a weizen glass, the beer pours a hazy gold color with about a 3-4 inch frothy white head. Head retention is excellent, and theres a decent amount of lacing. Aroma is nice and yeasty, the brew smells like clove, lemon peel, bananas, wheat/bready malt and some grassy hops. Taste is similar to the aroma, but theres also a bit of pear and orange peel noticeable, along with a slight bitter finish. Mouthfeel/body is light/medium, its smooth, easy to drink and has a good amount of carbonation. I think its a good brew, definitely worth picking up at $4.99 a bomber.
Cloudy gold with a huge white head. Crisp, slightly dry, yeasty. Citrus and spice. Nice and full.
Tap at Lazy Dog. Pours a transparent golden with a thin layer of cream colored head. Taste of grain and a hint of bananas. Aroma has the bananas too, with some malts and wheat.

Poured from 22 oz. bottle. 

Hazy, sparkling yellow with a huge 4-finger near white head and fair lacing. 

Aroma of grainy malt, wheat, banana, mild cloves and light lemon. 

Taste of caramel, lemony hops, wheat, mild cloves, apple and a touch of banana. 

Medium/light body and medium/low carbonization.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Looks, pours and smells like your typical Hefeweizen but taste betrays that myth. This is a wheat beer on Hops steroids and the hoppiness comes through in the lingering bitterness of the taste. More of a Double IPAD than a Hefeweizen

Pours a slightly hazy golden honey color. Big loose foamy head. Nose is malty with hints of banana and hops. Finnish is crisp, dry and a bit hoppy

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours a straw color with a nice foamy head. Aromas of malt and yeast. Nice spicey taste. Very enjoyable.
Cloudy yellow with giant white head. Nice hefe with some banana notes but more clove and spice. Medium mouth with medium carb. Purty good.

Bomber from The Davis Beer Shoppe. Pours translucent gold with a not very large white head. Aroma seems yeast/spice with banana ester notes. Med body or nearly. Spice is mild, and banana not all that powerful. Quenching it is. Lacking in flavor firmness for me. Does finish sort of wheat bitter.

Bottle and served in my Ayinger glass: Pretty tasty Hefeweizen will all the expected yeast driven components of banana and clove. Some lemony and peppery notes too. Just a touch lighter on the palate than the elite of the genre but after working 11 hours first day back the sprite mouth feel is welcomed.
Bottle. Clear gold with some floaties. Aroma is earthy with clove notes. Taste follows and adds grassy hops and a ton of wheat. Medium mouthfeel and light carb. Solid.

Beany aroma with only light hints of babyfood banana. Cloudy yellow, thick head. Medium body. Banana and beans, but a bit more of the former now on the palate. Alcohol slightly noticeable. Not a great example of the style, nor a great beer.

Bottle. Hazy straw gold with lots of sediment. Banana, light clove, grass, apple, wheat, floral. Light on the palate. Better than I expected. Good stuff 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bomber from TheEpeeist. Nose is grassy hops, whole wheat bread, and bananas with some light hints of cloves and bubblegum. lightly hazy yellow with a medium white head that laces lightly. Flavor is fruity, spicy, white peppery, and a hint of bitter.

22 oz. bottle. Pours a hazed straw golden with a medium white head. Good head retention, barely any lacing of which to speak . Aroma is softly fruity, bubblegum, and lemon notes. Flavor is mildly sweet with a subtle spicy character, a touch of lemon bitterness. Lively, spritzy palate, light bodied, with a fruity finish. A nice Hefewiezen for the summer.

22oz bomber shared by dmac. Pours a clear yellow color with a finger of foamy white head. Aroma of funk, sour lemons, grass, and floral hops. Taste of grain, floral hops, sugar coated lemons, and honey.
12oz from Spirits Boro. Poured a clear gold body with a smaller foamy white head. Aroma/flavor of honey, medium toast, flowers, sweet bread. Medium bodied with stronger carbonation. Meh.

Pours light gold into a shaker. Bright white head with medium retention recedes to skim surface. Sweet pepper aromas. Soft with sweet bubblegum and caramel upfront turning to pepper in the lasting finish.
Bomber into incorrect glass. Nose is a golden/blonde ale. Sip is wheaty and a tad spicy. Not what I come to expect for the style. Maybe my calibration is off. Slight floral notes. Meh.

Bottle.
Appearance: Hazy golden body with a semi-dense white head. Good coating, covering 99% of the body.
Aroma: Mild citrus aroma with a hint of clove, mild sweetness, a whiff of earth and a touch of banana. Easy aroma, balanced nicely. Not too inviting, but not bad.
Taste: Crisp wheat intro with a mild lemon mid-taste. The finish adds clove, a bit out of balance but not bad. Definitely a crisp and refreshing beer for the Summer.
Palate: Light and crisp with a slight creaminess to it.
Overall: This is a very crisp weissebier, maybe a little too focused on the spice presence, but enjoyable. The price is solid, though if it were a $8.99 six pack then it would definitely get a bump in overall from me slightly.

Growler from Patrick. Pours light gold, with a medium, bubbly, white head. The aroma is straw, wheat, bananas, and light and earthy pilsener-esque hops. Sweet up front, with a mellow, pleasant, and well balanced bitterness through the finish. Light to medium body, a little flat, and crisp. Overall, this is a pretty nice, refreshing Hefe.
Cloudy amber/gold color; Medium creamy body; Aroma of wheat, yeast, clove, & bananas; Flavor of wheat, some caramel, bananas, and clove; Nicely balanced; Good.
Bottle. Lemon/banana, clove, and wheat malt aroma. Hazy golden yellow with moderate head. Sweet orange/banana, clove, wheat malt flavor. Medium body. Pretty good.

Bomber shared. Pours a golden yellow color just a slight haze to it. Nice frothy white head. The aroma is classic Weiss through and through. Has a nice spice in the nose. The flavor is amazing malt, wheat and spice. This beer is amazing for true Weiss heads. Kudos again to victory brewing.

22oz bottle. slightly hazy gold with a big, loudy, fizzy white head and a lively appearance. aroma is a blend of grassy hop, green banana, and pale or pilsner malt. bubbly texture and lightish body for style. flavors of banana and grassy hops.
Very delicous wheat beer. Smooth and full of flavor. Pours a beautiful golden color. Very good.

Bomber. Pours a clear, pale straw color, big fluffy white head with ridiculous retention and excellent lacing. Nose is yeasty funk, bubblegum, banana, slightly mineral, daffodils. Mouth is medium bodied, creamy, slight malt sweetness, grass, banana, spice, bread dough, biscuit, mild bitterness at finish. Excellent!

22 oz bottle from Save On. First of all, it should be a crime to package hefe-weizen in 22 oz bottles. The bottom has to be swirled! Who the fuck has a 22 ounce glass to dump the whole thing into (other than actual Germans)? Pale hazy golden straw with small white head. Banana lemon pastry wheaty tangy aroma. Mild mango banana wheaty tangy fruity sweetness and grassy spicy/clovey medium bitter finish. Nice and light. Effervescent. My next glass will have the full sediment in it and probably be better, but this is punishment for putting it in a 22 oz bottle. Anyhow, thought it was destined for greatness, but only very very good.

22 oz bottle. Clear gold with a whipped white head. Nose is wheat, banana and grass; fresh and creamy. Medium body, substantial yet crisp and tingly. Taste is green banana, Sprite, faint apple, clove and grass. A touch sweet but nicely quaffable.
Crisp and satisfying. Malt backbone backed by lots of wheat and earthy things. Lemon, hop, spices and water. Medium texture. Medium duration. Another satisfying brew from V.

22 oz. bottle shared by Tmoney99. Pours a clear golden color with a small white head. The aroma and flavor have sweet malts, floral notes, banana, bubblegum, yeast, light spices, gets softer at the finish. Worth trying once.

Bottle. Poured a clear golden color with an average frothy white head that mostly lasted with excellent lacing. Moderate citrus, spice and wheat aroma. Medium body with a sticky texture and soft carbonation. Medium sweet flavor with a medium spicy sweet finish of moderate duration. Solid drinkable beer.

22oz bottle, thanks to Tmoney99 for sharing. Almost entirely clear golden color. Some fine dark particles suspended in the body. Thin white head. Loose bits of lace. Medium-plus body. Smooth, soft, lighter carbonation. More dry finish. Good hefe yeast aroma... Banana, light spice flavors, and a nice amount of solid, bready yeast. Moderate sweet taste, light bitter. Light spiciness. dry finish. Solid, bigger, more full hefeweizen.
Tap at Maltitude. Appearance of clear amber with frothy white head. Aroma of wheat and bread. Taste of bread with a slight spicy kick to it. Medium bodied. Very light and refreshing. Very good.
On tap at brewpub. Pours pale gold with white head. Wheat, banana, basement, some mild spices. Moderately sweet and bitter. Light crisp body. A bit too sweet for me.

A really nice true to style hefeweizen at Tap and Mallet Victory total tap takeover. If in blind taste test, Id probably pick this as an authentic German. Had a small one, but it was still in a properly shaped glass. Taste and nose dominated by cloves. Very fresh, clean and nice.

Tap at Lizardville Copley, with Greg. Pretty decent little hefe, easy to drink not a ton of bubblegum and spice so its easy for every body to drink. slightly cloudy but not thick.. decent little summer beer, surprised to see it in winter.
Golden yellow body, medium sized white head, spotty lacing. Fruity yeast notes, grass, light citrus, and cereals. Medium to light bodied, assertive carbonation, refreshing finish.
draft at coleman house, solid hefeweizen, good outside hot weather, drink in the sun banana clove juice

Draft. Pours gold with a slight white head. Fruity, grassy aroma. Lots of fruity esters that mix weirdly, but good, with the loads of hops. A very unique flavor profile of pineapple, banana, grass, pine. Nice and crisp.

It looks nice, smells nice , and has all the signifiers of a well-made beer, but wheres the banana? Id recommend this to people but I get the feeling that the hops in this are out-muscling the complexities. Not my bag.

Growler from Joe Canals in Lawrenceville, NJ. Pale yellow gold color with a medium-sizes creamy white head with nice lacing. Fresh citrusy wheat malt aroma has elements of lemon, yeast and minerals. Flavor is crisp and dry with notes of citrus and spicy wheat malt. Very flavorful and refreshing and true to the style.

Pours a clear golden yellow on tap with fluffy white head that sticks nicely. Aroma of German yeast and wheat. Taste follows, clean and well balanced, an American hefe I might be able to actually drink.

Draft at Proof. Pale golden pour with a small bubbly white head. Sweet bubblegum aroma with pale wheat malts, subtle spice and yeast with a catty hop presence. Flavor is similar with a silky mouthfeel and spicy and catty hop kick at the end. Not bad and very drinkable.

Growler from the brewpub through trade with Watson1977.  Less than two weeks tap to consumption.  Pours clear pale golden with medium white head.  Nice small bubble lacing, medium body, medium carbonation and spicy aroma.  Taste is complex spicy, yeasty, and some esters.  Just as much a belgian ale as a hefeweizen?  Not one of my favorites, but different.
Pale yellow with a slight haze. Spicy yeast aroma. Fairly light on the palate. Finishes clean.

Growler from JCs.  Really abundantly estery nose, just throwing them off left and right, golden sunshine with some lemongrass and a lot of lemony citrus, yeast.  Golden body with a lacing, fluffy bright white head.  Crisp and minerally taste, principally yeasty with strong citrus (and rising orange) and faint bubblegum.  Low bitterness, but a nice depth piece.  Meidum body.  Good quencher, worked well as a lawn mower despite the extra alc.  Definitely a Victory Weizen strain, the kind that inspires strong feelings on both sides.

This draft brew from the brew pub poured a small sized head of no head finely sized white colored bubbles that were mostly lasting and left behind a softly carbonated transparent yellow orange colored body and an excellent lacing. The mild aroma was malt hop. The mouth feel was tingly at the start and at the finish. The good flavor contained notes of wood wheat hops and malt. A decent one that I would consider buying again.
Draft at the source. Clear yellow color, thin white edge head. Aroma of banana bubblegum. Taste is similar.

Strange it has taken me this long to get around to it, but it was worth the wait. Nice traditional hefeweisen that actually has some body. No orange or lemon would go in this. Nice and bready on its own with a bit of cirtus.
Nice citrus yeast. Color is great. Flavor is traditional Weiss bier, maybe a bit stronger the your typical. Good drinker.

Draft. Pours a bright but slightly hazy orange with a small white head. Aroma is nicely fruity, somewhat citric and banana with a nice subtle spiciness. Flavor has a nice wheat backbone with the bright citric and pineapple character finishing crisp and clean. Medium body and a sharp carbonation. Very tasty beer.

Pours clear gold with a creamy white head...nice lacing and retention.  Aroma has light fruit and spice...like juicyfruit gum.  Flavor is more spice forward with faint fruit...passionfruit...and some yeasty notes.  Mouthfeel is medium and a bit syrupy yet lively with a dry spiced finish.
On tap at Victory.  Served in a sample glass.  Pretty tame for a hefeweizen. Moderate yeast character with a background of bread and malt. I expected a bit more.

Oh now this was nice. Served on draft at Beer Run. Pours a hazy lemon color with a thin creamy white head. Decent head retention. Aroma of citrus, pineapple and toasted wheat. The taste is citrus, pineapple, toasted wheat and a spicy finish. Medium bodied, creamy texture and quite refreshing. Very nice.

transparent gold, most effervescent of three, mildly wispy white head+ring. Lightly metallic banana esters, faint wheat, bit empty. Flavor shows more banana and citrus front, lightly dirty wheat mid with copper tones before a rich earthy wheat finish. Fizzy body highlights heavy sweetness. I dont like wheat beers.Whirlwind v. Mad King v. Sunrise all on tap at brewery go:1. Sunrise2. Mad King3. Whirlwind
Tap at Brewhaven.  Banana, wheat malt, and white grape aroma. Yellow with a small white head, spotty lacing. Sweet banana, wheat, light clove flavor. Medium creamy body.

Draft @ Sunset Grill and Tap on 6- 23- 2012. Straw yellow color with white head in a Weizen glass. Real subdued wheat nose. Higher carbonation.  Weak flavors of wheat, citrus, bread and clove. I was expecting more from Victory. This is an example of an American Hefeweizen that cant live up to anything German. The flavor was bland and real weak. Thin body, watery. Was something wrong with the lines or Co2?? It was a disappointment for this guy.
UPDATED: AUG 1, 2016 At Rockwell. Decent beer. Smooth drinkable but lacked some of the yeast flavor and aroma of other hefeweizens. Serving: Tap
Sampled at the 2012 American Craft Beer Festival.   Aroma has a lot of wheat in it.  A good beer for the style.
Draught at Zavino. Crisp and pale. Taste of wheat and maybe some honey. Nice overall.  Pretty yeast driven.

Stylistically this beer hits the marks! Excellent spicy nose and aftertaste, accompanied by a creamy wheat texture aroma and taste!!!!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
UPDATED: APR 19, 2012 Draft. Pours cloudy with a small white head. aroma has yeast and some spice. Taste has some orange and a bit of spice and clove. Not a favorite but solid for the style.
Nice and light easy drinking beer. Pale yellow with a frothy white head. The aroma is also light with some bread and a hint of lemon. The flavor is similar, very easy to drink. Finish is clean.
On tap at Victory brewpub, great head retention - still frothy after 20 mins, light and fresh aroma and taste, slight spice, great spring/summer beer

On tap at Oblivion Taproom. Noe is big notes of spices - cinnamon and clove - with some light fruity tones such as banana and citrus. It also reminded me of big red gum for some reason. Pour was a golden color with a thin white head. Taste was quite fruity with light spice and some bread in the mix. Nice stuff.
On tap at Beer Expo. Cloudy golden pour. Medium white head. Very easy drinking brew. Cloves, bannana, spicy yeast, rich malts. This beer went down nicely.

For an American hefe, this one was impressive. The nose was full of bready notes, yeast and clove. As for flavor, there were hints of banana and yeast among the light tropical fruit taste. With the higher carbonation it was dry and crisp, with a subtle yet satisfying bitter finish.

On tap at the Tap and Mallet.  Pours hazy dark golden with a small white head with decent lacing.  Lots O bubbles coming up.  Aroma of banana, spices, and lemon. The flavor is sweet, banana, spices, lemon, and a fair amount of hops. Great brew.
draft at Coles, golden pour. bubble gum, cloves, floral yeast notes in both aroma & flavor. lighter bodied. decent flavor, floral perfumy yeast adds an unique twist to this hefe. decent

Sweet taste, fruitful with some hoppy flavors. Very smooth with light co2. Clean finish with a warm sweetness.
UPDATED: AUG 19, 2012 Straw yellow white head aroma of bubble gum cloves yeast taste is similar. Medium body creamy mouthfeel tangy Finnish. Overall a very good hefe.
On tap at Barcade Jersey City.  Yellow with a little head.  Neutral, wheaty aroma.  OK mouthfeel. lacey. Mediocre drinkability.

Johnny Brendas, Philly tap ($5): Pours a hazy yellow color, with a white head. Aroma is of banana, clove, spices, and sugary maltiness. Taste is much the same kind of thing. On the sweet side of things. Rather spicy, in a very good way. Excellent balance and good flavor profile throughout.
Draft. Light yellow pour with white head.  Banana clove, spices, light Apple aroma tones.  Light wheat, fruit and spice, smooth finish.

Tap.  Pours a cloudy yellow gold body with a small frothy white head that fell to a partial covering.  Nice estery nose with lots of banana and clove with a touch of marshmellow.  Perfect yeastiness.  The flavor is spot on, nicely yeasty with tons of bubblegum and banana.  A light hint of hoppiness.  Mouthfeel is medium bodied with a nice thick yeast slurry texture and moderate fizzy carbonation.  I was never that big of a fan of this before, but this sample from the source is spot on.

Draft at the brewery.  Cloudy golden color, aroma of fruits, bananas, wheat, good collar with long lasting lacing.  Well- balanced, the fruits, hops, malts, and spices do not overtake the taste of this brew.  Smooth, medium bodied, great for the summer months.

Draft. Pour is a hazy straw yellow with a good white head. Excellent retention/lacing. Aroma is banana, clove, grass, grain husk. Taste was lightly sweet, lots of banana and bubblegum, on style. Texture is creamy, higher carbonation, clean finish. Very good but not too much different from Sunrise Weiss.

Draft. Poured a hazy golden yellow color, with a large foamy white head. Aroma was banana, yeast, wheat, grains. Flavor was wheat notes, with yeast, spices, banana notes, grains. This one was surprisingly good. Enjoyed it greatly.

On draft (guest)

Sample number two was a short one thanks to that filling imperial stout (and generous pour). If I had been stuck with this though I would not have complained too badly. After all it was a lighter style which was perfect for the summer months. Had I been outside on the patio this would have been a great choice.

Aroma and appearance - The shimmering white bubbly head was a perfect decoration for the sparkling gold body. Lemons splash across the nose along with the smell of a dusty oak end table. Latent esters awake over time.

Flavor and palate - Lemons, melons, and a number of other summer fruits brighten up the palate. White bread toasted to perfection tickles the throat before a sweet finish. Glowing it positively radiates summer as it hits the palate with its full force. Ultimately I am not sure I would want to ignore the other taps for it but at $6.00 for almost a liter it was a reasonable value.
just the best Hef in america.  Only problem is finding it these days.  Just awesome banana and bubblegum flavor.  Definitely a beer that you can knock back and enjoy for quite a while.

18 July 2011, tap at the brewery. very pale yellow, clear, some bubbles. soft banana wheat nose with even softer spicy coriander notes. thin, slightly watery body and mildly fizzy. nice hefe. not aggressively banana. coriander isnt there much. some faint spiciness. nice but i like a bit bigger body and bold banana flavor in my hefe.

Draft @ the brewery. Pours a hazy yellow color with a small white head. Has a fruity spicy wheat malty aroma with weak hints of banana. Fruity wheat malty spicy yeasty flavor. Has a fruity wheat malty spicy finish.

From a growler obtained at the brewery.  Poured into a pilsner glass.  Pours a clear???? golden color, just like Prima.  About an inch of head that dissipates in a minute or so leaving just a trace of foam over the top.  Aroma of bread, yeast banana and clove.  Mouthfeel is quite nice.  Its got some heft from the carbonation, but its not too carbonated.  Taste is very sweet... too sweet.  Plenty of yeast, fruit, bread, crackers and a little bit of apple.  Overall, its a well made beer, but I think its too sweet for me.  Worth a shot if you can find it or if youre in D-town.

Draft pour from the brass tap.  Served in a pint glass with an amazing dark orange color and a thiin fooamy white head.  Smells of wheat bannanas, and clove flare the nostrils.  Tastes just like the smmell with not an overpowering flavor of bannana, and a nice spice flavor aftertaste.
draft. Pours a hazy golden yellow with a thin white head. Aroma of banana, wheat, cloves and citrus. Smooth flavor of wheat, banana, citrus, cloves and some spices. decent hefe

Clear golden pour thin white head .... Aroma was bland light fruity yeast and wheat in the aroma .... Taste had light wheat and sweet malts and light fruity yeast with a spicy kick and some lemon .... dry fruity wheat finish meh an average brew
Draft at Pour House.  Cloudy dark Orange pour with medium off-white head.  Good overall flavor, but would like more wheat flavor coming through.
From tap at the brewpub. Pours hazy yellow with a small white head. Aroma is estery and slight fruity. Estery, slight wheaty and mild fruity flavoured. Medium dry estery finish.

Pours golden yellow with active carbonation and a white foamy head. Aroma is of lemon and spice. Taste is slightly sweet at the start followed by a distinct tartness followed by peppery spice.  Mouthfeel is a bit slick. Also has a pretty hefty yet delayed alcohol kick.
UPDATED: MAR 5, 2014 Nice cloudy pour with an aroma of yeast, wheat and banana. The flavors matched the taste. A  really good Weiss.
Pours light hazy yellow with white head.  Aroma of banana, bubblegum, wheat and citrus.  Taste was citrus sweet with some tartness on the finish.  Light and easy to drink.

Probably the first hefe ive had that I could see through. Not a ton of aroma. Pours golden clear with an inch head. Faint spice notes but lacks the burst of flavor a good hefe has. Probably the first victory beer thats disappointed me.
Draft at the brewpub: golden amber, clear, fruity aroma, fruity taste with a mildly bitter finish.

Draft at Kraftwork on 2/17/11.

Pours a very hazy golden yellow banana color with golden yellow hues when held to a light and a half finger white head that quickly fades into a lasting ring. Minimal spots of lacing left behind.

Slightly earthy, tart aroma with lots of zesty spice as well as some bready yeast and crisp citrus fruit. Hints of coriander, pepper, banana and lemon peel. The nose is pretty complex with lots of different characteristics bouncing off of one another. Nice and spicy but still has plenty of light, crisp citrus and yeast character.

Full bodied and very flavorful with an excellent balance of bread/yeast, citrus, light fruit and spice. The spice isnt overpowering with subtle pepper and coriander that compliments the citrus lemon peel and light banana flavor very nicely. The ABV of this beer isnt very high but it is well asked with little alcohol flavor, making this tasty beer extremely quaffable. Prominent banana and flavor which is a nice change for the style with the perfect spice, bread and citrus compliment.

Overall, I really enjoyed this beer and it was much better than I anticipated. I can easily see this becoming one of my favorite Victory offerings. Recommended.
tap at RnH hazy yellow, musty in all the right places; cinnamon, apples and pears, nutty caramel and nougat. smooth and easy drinking. Love when american brewers get german styles right.

On tap @ Rattle N Hum.
Light gold and hazy with a thin white head. Strong clove, nutty aroma with some citrus and banana notes. Light bodied, smooth, wheaty, and easy drinking. Right on style.
On tap at RattlenHum Victory week.  Lots of toasty wheat flavor, and a little bubble gum too.  Nice hefeweizen.

On tap at the Blind Tigers Victory event.  Pours a hazed gold with a medium white head that falls fast.  Banana and clove, wheat.  Soft light fruit.  A little citrus, smooth.  Creamy carbonation, sweet banana.  Nice wheat finish, a little more banana and yeast.

Tap at Victory. Was very impressed by this. It looks like a Belgian witbier with a super light straw to almost clear body that has a thick, white head that leaves excellent lace. Aroma is all German hefeweizen: insanely rich aroma that would put Weihenstephaner to shame. Just massive bubblegum, cloves, cream of wheat, fresh bananas. What an ultra rich nose for such a tame looking beer. Taste is cream of wheat, bananas, spices, some citrus peel. Creamy moving to chalky on the palate.

(Old BA rate - tap, BT 09)
Sunny, hazy yellowish color with a thinner pure white bubbly head. Citric and tart up front; some banana; spices as well. Seems like a cross between a Belgian Wit and German Weiss; citrusy but yeasty as well with spiciness; and the banana shows up toward the end. Touch creamy and medium overall; fairly muted carbonation. OK in this arena; good flavors, but Ive had more refreshing in the style range; was good that the citrus cut through the banana, but it was a bit scattered for my taste.  Still good, though
Cloudy yellow color with an aroma of banana, wheat, clove.  Flavor of wheat, citrus, and bread.  Light body.  Decent.

20100306 tap at brewpub. Pale, clearish golden with tiny head and active, visible eff. Aroma has nice banana bread notes, light fresh lemon, and cereal. Light bodied for a wheatiweissen. Flavor adds a nice bready complexity that keeps this one fairly interesting. Still, oddly, has some Victory house character, and maybe even some trace of floral hops at the finish.
Draft.  Pours a hazy golden body with a white head.  Banana, wheat notes, lemon grass, coriander.  Sweet full wheat body with a dry spiced finish.  Nice wheat ale.

Ive drank many hefeweizens and this offering from Victory measures up to authentic German varieties. Pours a cloudy orange with soft, white head. Aroma of yeast and coriander. Flavor is yeasty with some orange citrus notes. Very smooth and well-bodied for a hefe. I got this from the tap at Pony Bar. Loved it.

On tap at the pub. Murky yellow orange with a thin white head. Straight up banana and clove aroma. Some wheat malt notes and something a little musty. Flavor is the same. Its sweet but also kind of dry. Interesting beer.
Tap at the restaurant brewpub, Pours cloudy orange with a tan head.  Nose is sweet, wheaty.  Taste is sweet wheaty and ok.  Very smooth, tasty.

Growler from Victory Brewpub split with jredmond and courtesy of deputyandy.  Pour is a sexy orange hue slim daddy with yellowish tint. Taste was light spices w/ citrusnotes, hay, and wheat.  Not as clove or banana as I was hoping nor  entirely complex.  Thought this could of been bolder, but none the less... Still delicious and a strong contendor in the style.  Highly sessionable and refreshing. 3.65

UPDATED: JUL 1, 2013 Ginormous growler from Victory Brewpub. Popped open the growler and tons of smoke poured out - probably a good sign. It pours a hazy orange body with small white head. Aroma is sweet clove, fruit, and yeast.  Taste is really good - clove, and maybe a bit citrus.

Brewed in the USA.....On tap at the brew house. Pours a hazy yellow color with a medium white foamy head. Aroma of wheat, cloves and spices. The taste has a lemon flavor with grass, wheat and malts. The mouthfeel is pretty good !! But i will say i prefer the German version of wheat beers. However, this is a nice example.
On tap at Magoo’s. Spicy aroma, Cloudy golden with a slightly soapy taste, lemon but a bitter finish.  Similar to a belgian style golden without the alcohol/

On top at Victory. A great beer The taste was different than what I had expected, it was almost a hoppy victory taste in a weiss beer. I did enjoy and took a growler home with me. So in regards to wheat beers its hard to compare to the german ones because it has an american twist, but for the twist I do like it!

On tap at the Sharp Edge Brasserie, nice place. Pale vanilla yellow cloudy pour.  Barely any aroma but if I strain, I get a little wet hay.  Wet hay carries over into the initial taste. Taste buds detect grassy and wet hay flavors. Some bitterness but generally well behaved. As civilized as many belgie beers. Barely any carbonation.  This brew hides its alky content well.  I would have never known it was 6+%!  Decent session, rather friendly and enjoyable but I am biased toward wheat beers. Has a tingling hint of citrus in there too towards the end.
user_location: Beaver Valley, Beaver County, Pennsylvania, USA

text: Beautiful light gold haze...banana, cloves and spice... very refreshing...had to snag a growler of it...

At Victory. Hazy gold body with a finger of white head. Floral yet obviously unfiltered wheaty nose. Strong spicy wheat and yeast with notes of banana, decent cloves, and slight citrus. No great hop presence. But with lemon it puts franziskaner to shame easily. I would drink it again and I don’t even like wheat beers much.

On tap at Bocktown. A delicious and tasty hefe. Aroma was decent. Mild banana and clove with some light malt. Pour was a nice bubbly light gold with tons of tiny bubbles and a 2 finger white head. Taste was very full and crips. Strong banana, yeast and biting carbonation. Medium mouthfeel that is not too thick. Delicious.
user_location: Moon Twp, suburb of Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, USA

text: Golden hazy fills your pint glass, the first hollops you with yeast, wheat, and spice.  Citrus slightly sweet cascades down your thrat and leaves you thirsting for more....very well done and highly recommended.
hazy golden with mild white head.  flavor of sweet wheat with a nice alcohol component with a wonderful spicy yeast aspect.  a great weizen
Pours yellow with white head that leaves lacing.  Smells of wheat and bananas.  The flavor is mostly clove with some noticable sweetness from the banana.  Sticky and dry finish.

Tap at Blind Tiger. Aroma all bubblegum for me...nobody else seems to get bubblegum...interesting. Flavor very standard and boring hefe. Weak body for a hefe as well, not at all luxurious with yeast. Meh.
Darft at Victory in Downingtown. Typical cloudy yellow color, aroma of bananas. Taste is malty and nice touch of bananas. Light in texture easy to drink, good summer brew.

On tap at Blind Tiger.  Pours a cloudy light gold with a thick creamy head.  Aroma dominated by spices (clove).  Flavor also very spicy with some light bubblegum and banana.  A decent hefe, perhaps a little TOO spicy for my liking, as the spices masked a lot of the flavor of the beer.
Nice pour from tap; very pretty; cloudy with white white frothy head.  Smells of mld wheat, orange, spices.  Tastes clean and fresh; nice finish.

Feb . 2006 on tap at Victory - I could ditto eaglefan538s review...but that would be kinda boring. One difference, though...my version (on tap at brewery) didnt look unfiltered...in fact, it was crystal clear pale yellow (odd?). Mouthfeel was rather bubbly. The spices (cloves mainly) were VERY STRONG, as was the banana flavoring. In fact, the spices were so strong, I found it difficult to actually taste the wheat. Despite that, I was digging it...and Id go back again.

Draft at Victory....cloudy golden body off-white head....quite effervescent and fresh flavor....citrus and yeast, orange-esque...creamy and refreshing....light yeasty aroma with some apricot....apricot and orange flavors....a touch of sweetness throughout....as it sits on the bar, the clove becomes apparent, especially in the finish

Very nice Hefeweizen brew.  Weird how mine wasnt cloudy; as if it was filtered.  A little too oily for my tastes, this full bodied hefe had slight spicy notes on the nose with rich fruitful flavor on palate.  Enjoyed at Victorys brew pub.

Cloudy and golden, huge rocky, pillowy head, nice and thick.

Aroma: sweetness, & spice, and the usual ethereal delights found in any good, airy weizen. Cloves get louder, and that banana note rises above. Citrus notes peel out, too, eventually. (bad joke, I admit)

Brisk carbonation, big texture, coats the mouth, tingle of hops...very mellow, with flavors of citrus, banana, low-laying spice. Light-bodied, but substantial and satisfying. Little notes of lemon shine through the layers of wheat, bits of banana take turns on the tongue.

Leaves the palate tidily, with a linger of flavor, very refreshing, and urges a further drink.

Nice on
On draft at Capones. Pours hazy dark golden with a decent size white head. Aroma of banana, spices, and lemon. The flavor is sweet, banana, spices, lemon, and a fair amount of hops. Great brew.

Disappointing, quickly departing white head leaves the very opaque, murky muddy water yellow with strong brown leanings. Rather pasty feel all along, strongly bready. Lacking a bit in freshness  from the tap at Firewaters, Atlantic City, NJ and they have 50 draught offerings for a crowd that you would never suspect has ever heard of craft beer. The lemon wedge my beer was served with seemed to fit the environment. Beer is beer. Corona is beer and served with a lemon wedge, therefore all beers shall be served with a lemon wedge. Not rocket science. All that said, the royal weisse was cerealic and grainy, its malt profile was chewy and with more barley than actual wheat flavours. It manages to stay refreshing, but is a bit thick to do it well. I wish there were more to say about the yeast, but it stays in line with the breadiness, feeling minimally banana-like, but absolutely not phenolic and quite simplistic.
Draft at Capones. Clear light amber. Good lacing. Spicy wheat is the two word description I would use for this. Fresh floral/perfume hops with a little citrus. Very nice spiciness.

Draught at Blind Tiger.  Served in a tulip (!) Cloudy yellow color with a thin rapidly dissolving head. Muffiny banana aroma with some lemon.  Wheaty and fruity, kind of sweet but with a trail of spice on the finish to give it a bit of an edge.  Definitely drinkable, but not all that exciting, especially in that little glass.

Tap at blind tiger. Another miss from Victory. After last night, I lost all respect for this brewery. Cucumber, fruit, lactic aroma. Wheaty, sweet, too much fruit in the flavor. Really misses the style. Hardly prevalent yeast, lacking a tough, rigid head, totally missing German character. Even worse, its tough to drink, which for a beer like this spells doom.
Hazy, tannish gold.  Belgian.  Sweet Belgian aroma, perfume and floral notes, latent cereal.  Good, nothing special.  On tap, Eulogy, Philly.
On tap. Pours a cloudy golden color with a decent sized off-white head. Decent aroma, wheat and banana. Interesting flavor, seems hoppy but not overly bitter. Solid hefe.

Sampled on draft this beer poured a cloudy pale yellow color with a medium sized white head. The aroma was light but had yeasty, wheaty and banana elements. The flavor was lightly bready, wheaty and had undertones of bubblegum and banana. The beer was medium bodied.

Tap @ Victory.  Poured a hazy light yellow color with a white head.  Lightly malted aroma has a mild banana scent.  Some doughy notes as well.  The flavor started off with banana.  While that dominated there was a fair amount of spice, pepper, and clove.  The spices dominated the mostly dry finish.  Light to medium bodied.

On tap at Tuscadora Mill in Leesburg, VA.

Pours a very hazy pale straw with a one finger head that takes a long time to fade to a nice cap. The lacing is thick and sticky, leaving a nice sheet behind.

Smell; lots of cloves and wheat, with a little bit of bananas thrown in. There was a nice lemony citrus, as well as a touch of a peppery spiciness.

Taste; very nice wheat flavor right away, and then fades into the cloves, bananas and lemons. The spiciness that was in the aroma is there, it just took until the beer warmed up to come out. This was also a a little sweet in the finish.

Mouthfeel was medium bodied and very smooth, and the drinkability was really good, as I had no problem consuming a couple of these during dinner.

text: Quite possibly the fruitiest wheat that I have ever had.  This thing was loaded with banana, clove and bubble gum.  came out to me with a thin film of head and a very cloudy yellow glow.  flavor was very fruity with notes of spice.  medium palate.  a very nice hefe
A good sense of presence on this guy. Just the right carbonation, spices, and alcohol, I found this bear to be pleasant even though I am not a big fan of the genre.

Tap, Maxs American Craft Beer Fest.  Pours a hazy, whitish-yellow color; small white head with fine-bubbled lacing.  Chewy, bubble gum and clove aroma.  Lively carbonation.  Medium-to-full mouthfeel: plenty of cloves, bananas, and some light peppery spice; solid hefeweizen, but doesnt quite have enough estery oomph.  Very drinkable.  Medium, clove and vanilla finish.

Draft at Maxs.  Great looking wheat beer, glowing soft yellow cream colored body with a firm, foamy white head.  Mostly sweet, a bit spicy in the nose, solid solid aroma, very fresh and vibrant wheat and banana spices... extremely tasty yeast and wheat flavors, almost a saison spicy yeast quality at times... Crisp and refreshing, finishing with estery bananas and creamed wheat.

Tap at the Muddy Pig.  Hazy, pale golden appearance.  Aromas of fried banana and pineapple, maybe bubblegum.  Taste is quite refreshing with a burst of citrus flavor and a subtle undertone of wheat.  Crisp, soft, and tart.  Really nice aside from an entirely unnecessary wink of honey sweetness in the finish.  Right for the hot weather.

Draught at the Blue Dog in Chalfont.  Clear, pale straw body with a fading, sudsy white head.  Fruity yeast characters in the aroma with notes of banana, dough and light spice.  Nice wheat ale and yeasty flavors with decent attenuation and late bitterness.  Clean and enjoyable. Victory excels with their German-style decoction beers.
Draught Pale golden body with small head. Aroma is of spice, corriander, citrus. Flavor is very yeasty with a citrus tone to it, some spices. Sweet and decent. I could have sworn this was a Wit.
good beer.  really sweet and malty.  not a lot  of esters but solid.
Cloudy yellow with a dense head. Banana and pineapple are present in both aroma and taste. Fantastico!

This is a very decent Hefe Weizen. Not to extreme on the bananas in the nose or the taste. Nice and full of flavor though. Its spicy with cloves and vanilla yet overrun by pears and citrus, all balanced it such a manor that nothing seems too extreme. It is simply easy drinking. Bravo - Victory.

Hope this is helpful.
Cheers!
on tap-pours a creamy white head with pale yellow color and good effervescence.  Aroma is banana.  Taste is banana, creamy, wheat, smooth.  Nice occasional beer.

Tap at the brewpub. Cloudy yellow gold with a white head. Nose is yeasty, banana, clove, some lemon. Flavor is  banana, lemon, clove, coriander, and, of course, a nice, even wheatiness. Medium body. Excellent spiciness.

I enjoyed this unfiltered, cloudy, nice dark golden yellow colored beer. Not only were the usual citrus and banana flavors detectable, but the spices came across nicely. This bordered on a Belgian witbier and certainly transgressed German purity laws. Id have this one again, no doubt.
"Poured a hazy orange/yellow color with very small head. Aroma was spicy, of cloves. Didnt have the banana aroma i expected. Flavor was wheaty cloves. Not bad at all will do again"

Draft at brewpub. Pours golden. Aroma is a light sweet, yeasty, with your typical fruity esters. Light thirst quenching mouthfeel. I really like the flavor balance of the wheat malt and hops, and has the right amount of sweetness for my tastes. Sweet dry finish. Nicely done.

On tap at Victory.  Pours a slightly hazy golden with an average white foamy and lacing head.  Aroma of wheat, citrus and yeast.  Flavors of wheat, belgian spices, almost pickig up a minty taste.  Seems like the yeast used in this ias the same as their Golden Monkey.

1.14.05  Poured at the brewery.  A decent though unremarkable weizen.  At least in terms of what I have had in the past.  But taken on its own, Mad Kings Weiss is every bit a solid and highly drinkable beer.  Too bad it is only available on tap and most wont get to try it.

Had from a growler and at the brewery.  Pours a hazy straw color with a fluffy white head that had good retention.  The first that I noticed about this beer is it tasted like it used the same yeast as their Golden Monkey tripel and reading here I see that I am correct.  There is a decen amount of body to the beer with the flavors of clove, banana, and vanilla present.  This is a good beer.
I would expect better from Victory. An ok hefeweizen, but nothing remarkable.   Light colored.
Pours clear... expecting the typical cloudy wiezen.  I am going to deduct points for that.  Delicious wiezen though.  I had this at the brewpub in Downingtown.  Yum Yum.  COWBOY LIGHT YOUR FIRE.b

Just returned from the brewery, and this was the surprise of the night.  A traditional german wiess with belgian tripel yeast - wow!  Floral aroma that is beyond anything youd expect in the style.  Flavor and body are fuller than expected, with clearly an ample malt level.  A little spice appears on the end.  One of the brewers (John) laughed as I correctly guessed the yeast came from Golden Monkey.
This was a fairly nice brew.  Aroma was a bit of cloves, taste was smiliar with some spice to it.  Nice body, a bit cloudy.  A good hefeweizen.
cloudy golden color.  faint hint of lemon and malt.  not something i would get again but its always nice to try new things

Draft at Capital Ale House.  Victory makes some nice hefes.  Lightly hazy gold, little head.  Light aroma of clove and spice.  Full mouthfeel, good smooth wheat, and loads of bubblegum.  Touch of spice on the finish.  Nice, nice stuff.

Draught sample at Victory. Nice banana clove estery aroma, a good German wheat profile. Touch of vanilla. Cloudy pale yellow-gold wiht thin off-white lacing head. Medium bodied with medium smooth carbonation. Nice German wheat taste. Allspice and clove and good banana esters. Mild bitter finish with sweet and chalky after. Bit of Beemans gum.
A cloudy yellow appearance with a good amount of head. A big lemon and banana aroma. The flavor was bananas, cloves, lemons, and wheat. The aftertaste was slightly bitter. Pretty good beer.
Draft at OFlahertys in Bristol, Pa. Ok beer. Good thirst quencer. Was missing the bif weisse taste and smell. It had it just not enough.

Tap at Brewery-Quite pale for a Hefe, but loads of Hefe flavor. Actually, quite a bit bigger than I expected. Not as good as Pieces Big n Curvy, but still damn good. Lots of cloves and banana, light cloudiness. Good.
On tap at Victory.  Not my favorite style, but not bad.  Typical Hefeweizen.  Good for the style...

On tap @ brewery: Very cloudy, dark yellow-orange with a medium white head.  Aroma is yeast, banana, wheat, sweet wheat/malt.  Taste is wheat, sweet grains, yeast, pepper, spice, lemon, and citrus.  Finishes with a sweet & tartness from the wheat and yeast flavors.  Excellent offering from Victory.

UPDATED: AUG 4, 2007 First thing you notice is a cloudy apricot color, topped with a small white head.  Flavor was distinct and refreshing, banana and melon, typical wheat beer fruit, combined with an unbelievable clove spice bite.  Great full mouth feel.  Good spice and hop finish.  I would love to see this in the summer as a barbeque beer.  // Liked the draft even better this time.

Had a sample of this one down at Victory. Poured out a cloudy yellow color with a nice sized white head. The aroma was typical of a wheat beer. The taste was nice, light and smooth with notes of banana and of course wheat with a slight hop finish.
Tap at LV brewfest 04. Cloudy light yellow wityh a white head. Typical weiss. Light and crisp, with banana notes, and some slight clove. Slight hop notes.

text: UPDATED: FEB 28, 2005 On tap at the Lehigh Valley Brew Fest 04. Poured a hazy yellow color with a small white head. Aroma and tastes of bananas, lemons and spices. Decent Hefeweizen. Notes from 2/26 tasting; In addition to the above, wheat and flowers as well.

Slightly hazy, golden appearance.  Aroma was pretty true to style: fruity, yeasty, spicy.  Taste followed the same script, with notes of bubblegum, cloves, banana, pepper and vanilla.  After a few sips,  the previously undetected hops decided to make more of a statement;  they did not try to dominate, just added a bit of balance.  Pleasant, lasting finish.

Very heavy nose, almost sweet and nearly off-putting.  Nice hazy unfiltered look in the glass.  Taste is of sugar and wheat with a hint of alcohol (thankfully).  Aftertaste was interesting and refreshing.  Overall, a notable weissbier, but too sweet for my tastes.  On tap at brewery.

Pungent weissbier nose - spicy and fruity. Hazy pale orange color and low sticky head. Full wheat body with vanilla and clove accents. Is that a hoppy finish? Otherwise a strong German-style where. Impressive and rivals some of things I can find in Germany.

Madness indeed - I couldnt stop to order this - I assure you - I head the worst hangover in my entire life (the other 12 on tap plus several reratings of the Victory Golden Monkeys might have something to do with it too!) Yellow orange color with hints of green. Fizzy carbonation, little layer of a head, leaving laces on the glass. Grape an orange nose and taste with hints of vanilly. Peppery finish. Nice.
Quite clear for a hefe, appears filtered.  Not much nose.  Flavor is minty with bubblegum and plenty of spice.  Great palate, sticky and creamy.

Bursting with wheaty freshness, this was tart and tangy, with low banana, middling clove, and lots of herbs in the finish.  Great thick yet effervescent mouthfeel.  Very refreshing.  Not quite estery enough, though.

Citrusy and yeasty nose - no surprise there.  Flavor is sweeter than I expected, but not overly sweet.  A nice change.  That sweetness holds some nice citrus and yeast, and a but of alcohol.  The finish is sweet and lemony with a little spice.  The body on this is great.

Overall very similar to sunrise wheat.  Somewhat cloudy yellow/straw color with moderate white head and small lacing.  Good balance of flavor and aromas as far as clove/banana esters.  WHeat is very prominent in the flavor.  Aftertaste has a wierd bite to it - kind of a clove spicy bite.  SLight alcohol kick at the end.  Very nice.
Pours turbid straw-colored.  Aroma of yeast, malt, citrus, banana, and cloves.  Tastes citrusy, with a plethora of citrus and fruity flavors at the finish, as well as some yeast.  Very complex.
Hazy straw body with white head.  Aroma is lemon, clove.  Taste is medium sweet, spicy/yeasty, lemon, light clove.  Light, tart body.

Draft: Bleached canary yellow body. Thin, silky layer of dusty-white bubbles.  Peppery yeast, herbal hop aroma laced with mild notes of clove, perfume, banana, melon, soft dough, mandarin orange, mint, and honey. Soft body with a light spritz. Fresh clove flavors pounce the palate and are trailed by dough and juicy noble hops. Firm phenols in the background and soft layers of citrus. Lovely blend of lightly toasted pale malt and juicy melon. Clove and minty herbs numb the palate. Finishes appetizingly dry, which enhances the herbs and intensifies the clove, yet robustly full, with notes of flowers. Citrusy aftertaste cushions the dryness. Among the best Hefes in the states, hands down.

text: (sample @ brewery)  beer a suprisingly bright yellow/gold with a subdued banana/clove nose.  flavor is typical hefeweizen, perhaps sweeter than most, with the banana/clove yeast flavor a bit more subdued than usual for a german hefe.  a little heavy for repeat drinkability.

Cloudy golden yellow with a a white head. Light wheat aroma. Spicy flavor with pepper and citrus balanced by some wheat sweetness. Body is bigger than expected. Decent but a little too mellow all around.

Lightly cloudy pale yellow with good head with light lacing. It could probably stand to be cloudier. Theres more clove than banana on the nose, but the banana comes out more in the flavor. A good dry wheat backbone backs the yeast flavors up nicely.
Whoa!  That is one clean smelling beer!  Very refreshing citrus and wheat aroma.  Cloudy orange body with a nice white lace.  Hops and wheat flavor followed with a spicey, dry finish.  Very good.

UPDATED: MAY 5, 2006 Tap @ Victory. Cloudy gold/yellow. Good head that fell quick. Aroma was abundant, very fresh yeast. Flavor was of cloves, even more than the Golden Monkey. I cant get into this clove flavor. I just dont like this style. 5/5/06: Ive changed my way with this hefe. Very clean and refreshing although a bit thin on the palate. Im upping it to a 3.4.
Pours very dark. More like a dunkel. Cloves but no bananas in the aroma. Way too much body and not enough CO2.

Poured a hazy orange brown color with a small off white creamy head and some sparce lacing.  Spicy, wheaty, clove aroma with a sweet clove taste.  Co workers of mine described the aroma as watermelon bubblegum.  Very wheaty and the taste was almost cloying it was so sweet, but left a nice soft carbonation.

I had this side-by-side with the Paulaner Hefeweizen, and while I liked this beer, I found it difficult to understand.  Thin, clinging head on a hazy, yellowish body.  Sweet, cloyinging so, with everything leading me to write "big" in my notes--banana and bubblegum, coming on more as it warms.  Interesting and a slightly different interpretation within the style.  I wouldn't rave about it, though it does have its attractions.  (on tap, Ludwig's Garten, Philadelphia)
Very cloudy amber color - some spiciness & citrus flavors throughout.  Clean & dry with a bit of bitterness.  Had a good wheat beer flavor without too much sourness.  Nice.
The best beer I have ever had. Also the most Cloudy.It has a very fruity aroma.
A fairly crisp and hoppy wheat that's more reminiscent of an American Wheat than a German one.  Some citrus flavor.  So-so.
Blonde, but cloudy - light, but lasting head.  Tastes similar to a Belgian Strong Ale, at least as far as spices go.
Lemony and zesty - slight spices and sweetness - cloudy yellow, nice lacing - not much else to say.
Cloudy light tan.  Banana and spice aroma.  Dry and hoppy, seems a bit minerally, too.

Cloudy dark pineapple yellow color.  Yeasty and fruity nose, but where this beer really happens is the body.  Sweet, thick maltiness and a light refreshing tartness is accented by a nice yeastiness and touches of citrus.  Complex and a winner in my books.

Has the appearance of murky, upstate New York apple cider. Small, quickly dissipating, creamy white head. No lacing.
The nose holds notes of grapefruit peel, banana, original flavor bubble gum and black pepper.
The flavor is malty and citrusy with black pepper up front. Balanced nicely with a tangy and lightly bitter hop presence on the backside.
Medium-bodied with a creamy mouthfeel and fizzy carbonation. Short, dry finish with oak at the wee end.
Refreshing brew on a hot day!

UPDATED: SEP 8, 2004 Draught @ Victory.   The beer pours a cloudy, darker golden color, with maybe a hint of orange to it. Some citrus in the bouquet, as well as some yeastiness. Good taste of wheat malts and some citrus. A lemon was supplied with it, but not squeezed, so the citrus was inherant. An excellent wheat!
Cloudy orange-gold with classical banana scent.  These guys nailed the citrusy-yeast flavor familiar to German domestic weissbier.  I'm not a wheat lover, but this beer rocks.

Draft at Victory - A little darker than a standard Weiss.  Not much aroma present.  Taste is good with hints of banana and clove.  Tastes like a light or mild Bavarian wheat.  This beer is, however, dangerously smooth.

UPDATED: APR 4, 2003 I had this on tap at Victory. A good variation of a wheat beer.  Different than most. Cloudy yellow. Had sweet light flavor, with fruit notes, very refreshing. Reminded me slightly of franziskaner.
a very sweet german white.  Intresting,  but ive way to much to drink tonight...  good stuff,  im just not a greman wheatguy...
Had it at Ludwigs Garten (only place to get it?) Good summer beer
had it (draft) recently and liked it better than I remember. a different kind of wheat beer than most of the white/wits out there. Uses a belgian yeast I believe. Try it!
Maybe I am just partial to wheat beers but I loved this one. Very thirst quenching, nice light spicy twang with citrusy flavors. Quite delicious.
Didnt have that wheat beer zig to it, didnt really smell like much of anything, very watery
Interesting beer that had a different aroma and taste I suspect due to the special yeast.  Hard beer to come across so if you have the chance sample it!
Nice light weisse. Good looks and pleasant taste. Nice variation on a great style.
